body:
### Describe the bug

When processing `mlx5dv.pyx` from [rdma-core](https://github.com/cython/cython), Cython 3.1.0rc1 hangs (with 100% CPU usage). I have also reproduced it with 15cabc271aa7e17496264612b2732735c33b4bf6.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

I have been able to reduce it to the following code:

.pyx:
```cython
# SPDX-License-Identifier: (GPL-2.0 OR Linux-OpenIB)
# Copyright (c) 2019 Mellanox Technologies, Inc. All rights reserved. See COPYING file

from libc.stdint cimport uintptr_t


cdef class Mlx5Cqe64:
    def __init__(self, addr):
        self.cqe = <mlx5_cqe64*><uintptr_t> addr

    def dump(self):
        dump_format = '{:08x}\n'
        str = ''
        str += dump_format.format((<uint32_t*>self.cqe)[0])
```

.pxd:
```cython
# SPDX-License-Identifier: (GPL-2.0 OR Linux-OpenIB)
# Copyright (c) 2019 Mellanox Technologies, Inc. All rights reserved. See COPYING file

#cython: language_level=3

from libc.stdint cimport uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t, uintptr_t

cdef struct mlx5_cqe64:
    uint16_t    wqe_id
    uint32_t    imm_inval_pkey
    uint32_t    byte_cnt
    uint64_t    timestamp
    uint16_t    wqe_counter
    uint8_t     signature
    uint8_t     op_own


cdef class Mlx5Cqe64:
    cdef mlx5_cqe64 *cqe
```

I haven't gone beyond that since it's standalone already, and didn't want to accidentally remove too much information.

### Expected behaviour

No hang :-).

### OS

Gentoo Linux amd64

### Python version

3.13.3

### Cython version

3.1.0rc1, 15cabc271aa7e17496264612b2732735c33b4bf6

### Additional context

Original Gentoo bug report: https://bugs.gentoo.org/955375

comment_data.body:
```
def dump():
    dump_format = '{:08x}\n'
    str = ''
    str += dump_format.format(1)
```

is a simpler version that's sufficient to reproduce the problem

So it's getting caught by:

https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/15cabc271aa7e17496264612b2732735c33b4bf6/Cython/Compiler/ExprNodes.py#L2044-L2048

On the first run through the type inference, `str` is an object type, and so it correctly identifies that everything being assigned to it is a Python string and so updates the type to Python string. On the second run through the type inference, it trips the code above and thus decides that type of `str` in the right-hand side of `+=` must `type`. And so it just keeps looping between those two options.

It bisects to 2a2c98364d032de3567fae282fc1d94422c7cb86 but that feels slightly incidental to the real bug.

Not sure I'm smart enough to fix it right now.

Finally

```
def dump():
    dump_format = []
    list = [] 
    list += dump_format
```

will reproduce the same bug at least as far back as Cython 0.29.1. So it's "only" a regression because we now type `str` as a Python rather than a somewhere-between-Py-2-and-Py-3-mystery-string-type.
Interesting. At least then there's an easy work-around: rename the variable (`str`) to something other than the type name of the value.

A quick fix for this specific code seems to be an additional test for `not self.is_target`. If the name is the target of an assignment, it's definitely not the intended case of referring to a builtin type.
Thanks for the report. I've backported the fix to the 3.0.x branch.
I don't think it fixes `list = list + dump_format` though so may be worth following up with a better long-term fix at some point

> I don't think it fixes `list = list + dump_format`

Confirmed, that's still an issue. The git history is pretty unclear about this piece of code:
https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/ad18cb016a78a6830c17fd9eccb1b8a68d8e5a95/Cython/Compiler/ExprNodes.py#L2044-L2051
It is needed, but it might be that other code simply depends on its incorrect behaviour and then does the wrong thing when it's disabled. At least, it breaks a lot of tests to remove this part.

I'll retarget it to 3.2 to look at later.
I've possibly got a better fix (it at least passes the type inference tests, but I don't yet know about all the other tests)

rename.from: [BUG] Cython 3.1.0rc1, git hangs in type inference for `mlx5dv.pyx` from `rdma-core`
rename.to: [BUG] Cython (3.1.0rc1, git) hangs in type inference for `mlx5dv.pyx` from `rdma-core`

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: [BUG] Cython (3.1.0rc1, git) hangs in type inference for `mlx5dv.pyx` from `rdma-core`
